title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a goal from center ice during Team USA's Olympic win against Denmark, describing it as a lowlight.
Despite the error, Swayman humorously claimed being colorblind negated any impact from the ice's black boards on visibility.
Swayman possibly made his sole Olympic start, with Team USA having strong goaltending options like Connor Hellebuyck and Jake Oettinger.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum, recovering from an Achilles injury, might return this season, impacting the Celtics' playoff prospects.
NBA players like Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony speculate on Tatum's potential return and its effect on the league.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress toward rejoining the team.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to spend this offseason, focusing on free agents at key positions.
Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker, and Bills C Connor McGovern are notable options for Patriots.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips also identified as potential free agent targets for Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have a new partnership making ESPN the streaming home for MLB games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99; non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV subscribers will be automatically renewed and can access content via ESPN's app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. reported Jayson Tatum showed promising performance during a G League practice with the Maine Celtics.
Jayson Tatum practiced with the G League as part of his recovery from an Achilles tear, raising return speculation.
Celtics' officials remain cautious, stating Tatum will only return when fully ready, with no timetable yet announced.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 report, excelling in higher education attainment and school performance.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree, highest nationally.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked at the bottom for education.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card owned by a Massachusetts family is up for auction, ending February 21.
The card, discovered by Ken Goldin, holds ties to a Taunton-based silver manufacturing family, remaining ungraded for 116 years.
The auction, led by Goldin, has a current bid of $3.9M, potentially selling at $4.758M with buyer's premium.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut as the starting goalie for Team USA against Denmark.
Swayman had a strong performance at the 2025 IIHF World Championship, going 5-0 and achieving a shutout.
Swayman's 2025-26 NHL season stats include a 22-12-3 record with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale found off Virginia as Porcia's 2023 calf.
Scientists will conduct a necropsy on the whale, marking the second right whale death in two weeks.
The species is critically endangered with roughly 380 individuals remaining; 43 confirmed deaths since 2017 investigation.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A seventh child in Massachusetts has died from influenza, part of a total of 260 flu-related deaths this season.
State data indicates 253 adults and seven children have died from flu-related illnesses by February 7.
Massachusetts public health officials emphasize vaccination due to ongoing flu activity, particularly affecting children and the elderly.
